intro: Middendorfia hamulosa, commonly known as the trailing bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of blue to violet flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Middendorfia hamulosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
